cold_snaps.status: No active cold snap is observed currently.  The count for this year stands at 6, while the average is around 3.7 per year.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4-27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwave.status: No heatwave is happening right now.  There have been 6 such events this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9 per year.

heaviest_rainfall.status: Record amounts of rain fell over 7.9 hours today with a total accumulation of 13.04mm.  It fell at 8.6 mm per hour at times and ranked 8th from our records.  The most intense rainfall recorded took place on 04 January 2025, with precipitation totalling 27.64mm reaching 4.6mm per hour at times.  The event lasted 15.9 hours.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A rapid deluge happened today when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour (ranked top in our records).  The storm lasted 2.0 hours and 7.99mm of precipitation fell during that time.

storm.status: Rain fell for 23.2 hours on 23 November 2024 creating a new record.  The storm produced a total of 24.56mm at a maximum intensity of 6.4mm per hour.
A storm is currently nearby.  It's the first significant stormy weather event since 02 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: It is currently one of the longest rainy periods.  It is the ranked 5th longest since our records started in August 2024.  There have been 9 consecutive days where it has been rainy starting on 26 August 2025.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

tropical: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current wind direction is southerly (202°), which is about average.  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.  The long-term average wind run is 229.42 miles and so far today the wind run is 74.47 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.9°C) and outside temperature (up 3.1°C) and more moisture-laden rainfall (up 2.0 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 1539 m) and inside temperature (up 2.1°C) when compared to today.

Yesterday, cloud levels hit a low of 713m and a high of 1594m, averaging 1119.9m; the past week and month reported somewhat higher averages.

summary.summary: Inside; a mild and comfortable temperature is anticipated. Outside; the temperature will feel nicely warm and pleasant. Also, extremely heavy humidity levels and near calm conditions. Rain showers likely, the sky may alternate between sunny and overcast, and moderate levels of sunlight will be present. Weather could become unsettled.
